dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.backend

Class AbstractBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
      • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.backend.AbstractBackend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDCtxtBackend

    public abstract class AbstractBackend
extends dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
    The AbstractBackend is the controller of a wizard. Each wizard must implement an AbstractBackend that controls the lifecycle of a wizard. The backend has the following functionality:
    • Receive all wizard lifecycle events including all GUI lifecycle events like page switches
    • Manages the private model aka. memento tree of the wizard
    • validates the private model of the wizard
    • controls the GUI of the wizard
    • provides the access to the project DataModel
    All methods that should be overwritten are named do*().

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

      • doGetMementoFactory

        public AbstractMementoFactory doGetMementoFactory()
        The private model of the wizard is represented by a tree of mementos that are created by a AbstractMementoFactory. This method may be overridden to provide a customized (means derived) AbstractMementoFactory. A customized Mementofactory for example can provide mementos filled with defaults are custom memento implementation that provide a more convenient interface for accessing data. The default implementation returns a DefaultMementoFactory.
        Returns:
        The AbstractMementoFactory of this wizard
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getMemento

        public Memento getMemento()
        This method provides the root memento of the private model of the Wizard. This method is not meant to be overwritten.
        Returns:
        The root memento (never null)
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getMementoOperationHandler

        public MementoOperationHandler getMementoOperationHandler()
        This method returns the MementoOperationHandler that is used by this wizard to schedule changes to the private model of the wizard. This method is not meant to be overwritten.
        Returns:
        The MementoOperationHandler of this wizard (never null)
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doIsAvailable

        public APIOperationStatus doIsAvailable()
        This method is called to query if the wizard is available when the user tries to open the wizard or tries to run the wizard operation. The default implementation returns null.
        Returns:
        If the wizard is unavailable an operation status must be returned that provides a corresponding error else null should be returned
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doIsSystemModelValid

        public APIOperationStatus doIsSystemModelValid()
        This method is called before the wizard or the wizard operation will be run. If the verification fails the wizard will not be started. The default implementation does nothing and returns null. You can use a standard AutosarVerififier which verifies that all mandatory elements are available or you implement your own custom verifier which checks all your requirements to the system model.
        Note that you should only check the elements your backend really needs because the system model is possibly not complete because of partially imports (e.g. the dbc file import does never import all elements, references and attributes required by Autosar).
        Example to use the Standard Autosar 3.x Verifier
        public APIOperationStatus doIsSystemModelValid() {
        ...
        IVerifier verifier = dreisoft.tresos.tresosdb.api.model.v1.verifier.AutosarVerifier31_6.INSTANCE;
        APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
        myEntity.verify( verifier, true, status );
        return status;
        }
        }

        Example to create a Custom Autosar 3.x Verifier
        class MyCusomVerifier extends dreisoft.tresos.tresosdb.api.model.v1.verifier.AutosarVerifier31_6{
        public void verifyPPortPrototype( IPPortPrototype pPortPrototype, APIOperationStatus status ){
        // Perform the things you need to verify
        }
        public void verifyRPortPrototype( IRPortPrototype rPortPrototype, APIOperationStatus status ){
        // Perform the things you need to verify
        }
        //More of your verifications
        }

        public APIOperationStatus doIsSystemModelValid() {
        ...
        IVerifier verifier = new MyCusomVerifier();
        APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
        pPort.verify( verifier, true, APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus() );
        return status;
        }
        }
        Returns:
        A APIOperationStatus which contains the verification errors of the system model or null if no errors occurred.
        Since:
        12.0

      • doInit

        public void doInit()
        This method can be used to initialize the backend. This method is called right after instantiation of the backend before anything else is initialized. This means that the root memento is not yet been created and there is no GUI. The init() method is only called once in the wizard lifecycle. The default implementation does nothing.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doShowPage

        public void doShowPage(AbstractPage page)
        This method is called any time a page of the wizard is shown for the first time or when a page switch occurs right before the page is shown.

        The enablement of the back/next buttons for multi pages opened as dialog can be changed here, e.g. to disable the next button until the page is correctly configured. See AbstractPage.setNextButtonEnable(boolean). To change the button enablement again, the method doValidationFinished(List) can be used, which is called directly after validation has finished.

        After each page creation and each page change, the enablement setting of the back/next buttons is reset (i.e. they are enabled by default). The actual status of the button also depends on the existance of the corresponding page. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        page - the page that will be shown
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doValidate

        public java.util.List<ValidationResult> doValidate()
        This method is called asynchronously every time the model of the wizard is changed to query if the model has errors. The default implementation does nothing and returns null.
        Returns:
        Errors found in the model
        Since:
        2008.b

      • isValidationCanceled

        public boolean isValidationCanceled()
        Query if the validation for this wizard has been canceled.
        Returns:
        true if the validation has been canceled, false if not
        Since:
        10

      • doIsRunPossible

        public boolean doIsRunPossible()
        Returns if the wizard can be executed or not. The default implementation returns true if there are no validation errors. If you want to change this behavior you may overwrite this method. When returning false, then please at least add a warning to the validation results as a hint for the user how to solve the problem.
        Returns:
        true if the wizard can run, false otherwise
        Since:
        23.0

      • doRun

        public java.util.List<APIOperationStatus> doRun()
        This method executes the wizard which means that this method is responsible for altering the project model according to the changes that the user requests the wizard to do. This method is called when the user presses the finish button, runs the wizard from the commandline or closes the editor that represents the wizard. Calls to this method are synchronized and multiple AbstractBackend are therefore never executed in parallel. The default implementation does nothing and returns null
        Returns:
        List of errors or null
        Since:
        2008.b

public void handleUpdatedData(java.lang.String[] affectedPaths)
        Deprecated. 
        Called by the engine after changes in the GUI were written back to the mementos.

        Called doHandleUpdatedData(List).

        Parameters:
        affectedPaths - The changed Paths
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doHandleUpdatedData

        public void doHandleUpdatedData(java.util.List<java.lang.String> affectedPaths)
        Called when in the GUI data was changed after the data was written to the mementos and after the GUI was so far updated for the change.

        This method can be overridden to switch GUI elements that depend on the content of other GUI elements for example.

        NOTE: The affected paths are absolute paths starting with a '/'. If the whole GUI is to be updated (e.g. when the page is shown the root-path '/' is handed in.

        Parameters:
        affectedPaths - The changed paths (sub path could also have changed)
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doUpdateWidgetEnablement

        public void doUpdateWidgetEnablement()
        This method is called asynchronously after doValidate() each time the wizard configuration did change to update the GUI state. The default implementation does nothing.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doValidationFinished

        public void doValidationFinished(java.util.List<ValidationResult> results)
        This method is called directly after a validation has finished.

        It can be used to perform changes to the GUI, depending on the validation results. For example the enablement of previous/next buttons for multi page dialogs can be changed: 

         // if any error occurred, then the next button becomes disabled
 for (ValidationResult result : results)
 {
     if (result.getStatus().getSeverity() == APIOperationStatus.SEVERITY_ERROR)
     {
         getPage().setNextButtonEnable(false);
         return;
     }
 }
 getPage().setNextButtonEnable(true);
        The enablement of previous/next buttons is reset on each page change. By default the buttons are enabled if a previous or next page is available.
        The enablement of the finish button cannot be changed. It is only enabled, if validation returns no errors.

        Furthermore this method can be used to change the background and foreground colors of table and treetable cells. 

         rowMemento.setString(SWTTableController.ATTRIBUTE_PREFIX_BGCOLOR + IConstants.MEMENTOID_COLUMN_INT, "#FF8040");
        In this case mementos are changed and the method updateView(List) has to be called with the list of the changed memento paths, so the changes are adopted in the GUI.

        The default implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        results - The list of ValidationResults
        Since:
        10

      • changeWidgetEnablement

        public void changeWidgetEnablement(java.lang.String widgetId,
                                   boolean enabled)
        This method can be called by doUpdateWidgetEnablement() to enable or disable (grey out) a widget.
        Parameters:
        widgetId - The id of the widget
        enabled - The state (false to grey out)
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getWidgetFactory

        public WidgetFactory getWidgetFactory()
        The WidgetFactory is used to create GUI widgets for the pages of the wizard.

        This method calls doGetWidgetFactory().

        Returns:
        The WidgetFactory of the wizard (never null)
        Since:
        2008.b

      • doGetWidgetFactory

        protected WidgetFactory doGetWidgetFactory()
        This method can be overridden to provide a custom widget factory.

        The standard implementation does provide a default factory instance of WidgetFactory.

        Returns:
        The custom factory
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getPage

        public AbstractPage getPage()
        This method gives access to the actual GUI of the wizard. The wizard if it has a GUI can have either a single page or multi pages (accessible either via tabs or previous and next buttons). If the wizard is a mult-page wizard the returned page is an AbstractMultiPage that itself contains subsequent pages.
        Returns:
        The page of the wizard if it has a GUI else null
        Since:
        2008.b

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Called to close the wizard and remove all used resources.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • navigate

        public boolean navigate(java.lang.String widgetId,
                        java.lang.String mementoPath)
        Navigates to the first widget with the given widgetId and/or Memento path. Either the widgetId or the path can be null. If the widgetId is not null or empty, the first widget found with the given widgetId will be focussed. In this case the Memento path will either used for navigation or not. This depends on the implementation of the widget controller. If the widgetId is null or empty, the Memento path will be used to find the associated widget.
        Parameters:
        widgetId - the widgetId of the widget to navigate to or null to navigate only with via memento
        mementoPath - the Memento path or null to navigate only with the widgetId
        Since:
        2008.b

        public void updateView(AbstractPage page)
        Update the GUI of the given page.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to update
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getValidationResults

        public java.util.List<ValidationResult> getValidationResults()
        Fetches the results of the last executed validation (without triggering a validation run itself).
        If there is no currently running validation, this immediately returns the results of the last finished validation run. If there is a currently running validation, this waits for the validation process to end and returns the results.
        Returns:
        list of ValidationResults
        Since:
        10
